Key Match Events: Brazil missed a string of chances and were left to rue a lack of quality in the final third after they were held 0-0 by Costa Rica
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil came into the Copa América on the back of a run of poor results in recent months
Post-Match Reflections: Marquinhos: 'Now it's about being honest with ourselves, creating alternatives to create chances, scoring, results are important in this competition, points left at the beginning can complicate things at the end'
Paqueta: 'We played a great game, we fought until the end, I had three chances myself, we were frustrated not to win, but we left with confidence, we fought'
Alfaro: 'We were Bruce Willis in 'The Sixth Sense,' where the only one that did not know he was dead was him, right?'
Others: Costa Rica's resolute five-man defence frustrated Brazil
Raphinha had an excellent early opportunity to score but Costa Rica keeper Patrick Sequeira came quickly off his line to snuff out the danger
A free kick was flicked on by Rodrygo into the path of Marquinhos, who poked it in at the far post but the goal was disallowed for offside after a lengthy VAR delay
Lucas Paquetá rattled the woodwork with a long-range effort in the 63rd minute
Coach Dorival Junior brought on youngsters Endrick and Sávio in the 70th minute as Brazil desperately sought a winner
Neymar, who has been sidelined by an anterior cruciate ligament injury, cut a dejected figure as he looked on from the stands
Colombia lead Group D following their 2-1 win over Paraguay earlier on Monday
